title: new zac is underwhelming and gimmicky
body:
and then i noticed that of the 3 that were reworked {{champion:57}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:154}} , maokai and sej are very reliable. 
they have point and click roots, stuns, knockbacks, and huge ults that leave little room for error. 
sej's ult even changes depending on distance, you can use it point blank for a shorter but much safer cc or long distance for a much stronger version.
_edit: maokai's ult root gets stronger with distance also
_

zac's new kit is... really clunky and just gimmicky. he lost all his damage and reliability for gimmicks that riot seems to have thought would be OP because they seemed unique.

also sidenote on his numbers after patch http://lolalytics.com/champion/Zac/
his winrate plumetted while his playrate spiked. okay so new people are trying him... pickrate goes back down but winrate keeps going down. yikes.


please just keep his new Q and change back everything else. his new Q is very clunky, hard to see, and does zero damage from before but i admire the idea. everything else were nerfs for gimmicks.

replies.body: this is actually fucking hilarious how bad riot did this rework.

Zac rework is a JOKE. You can't do anything; inane impractical Q and R, rest of his kit is dragged down into obsolescence. Did they even test out this travesty in applied gameplay or just fold their arms and say AAAYYYYYYYYYYYY wacky Zac thematic clarity!!!

Worst champ in the game now.
The windows to use his new Q & R are awkwardly short. I could see them being good in teamfights, but not as good as his original abilities.

i cant belive you actually call zac useless, i have never had more fun and carried harder with him than now.
His ult is basicly an easy kill against everyone it catches, as it is a long stun and an unpredictable move
His new q got an insane range and if you are able to time it quickly you will be able to pick up a ton of free kills early.
Zac is alot more about teamplay and cc now, enabling easy and save wombo combos if you hit your ult, having no problem taking out a fed adc or mage and when played fulltank never needs to go back because you just have so much health regen with your blobs.

He had way more health regen in the past, which is why he could stay in jungle so long.  However, his R is just.. plain underwhelming. We were all hyped up for a powerful ult, that could do MASSIVE damages. What happened instead? We got a completely weak and useless ult, that does a lot LESS damage than the past. Another part, he could actually screw over his own team with his R. Also;He can't escape with his R as easily anymore.

his q makes jungling alot easier since it is a free stun on the strong creeps. he is the easiest jungler right now, not having to activate a single health pod while taking every camp, he doesnt need more health regen than that.
if you call an ult that is easy to hit and can easily turn a fight or even a game around useless, then i dont know what you want from zac.
He is NOT supposed to be a full ap bruiser mage but a cc heavy supporting tank, that can engage fights and take out damage dealers. 
If you screw over your team with his new ult that is entirely your own fault. you beeing bad doesnt make the char bad.
Just dont play him full ap and expect to kill the entire enemy team and you are fine...

Of course he isn't. But his regen was what defined him.  I played him full tank, and as a bruiser.  He had the damage to be able to do this, and was still able to be killed by fast moving targets. However, his R truly did lose a large amount of Damage and if you add in the fact that he lost the blobs he could have gotten from his ult, then he loses even more damage.  Already, his R lost 60% of its damage, and now only drops 1 blob, regardless of how many people you hit.  Second, his Q's cooldown. I'd much prefer the old one if the cooldown for his current Q is a short tug, and a 11 second wait at level 1.  It slows him down considerably.  His QW combo was a defining feature that let him hit well, as well as regening much faster.  The point of his Q's low cooldown in the past meant that he could spam it, and allow his W a faster cooldown time. However, with the longer cooldown, he loses about 1 W more than before.  Now, I haven't messed up with his ult yet. It could be useful, but he lost so much damage, that it sometimes isn't worth it. He still takes damage in the flattened form, drops 1 blob, and could be messed up on complete accident on no fault of our own.

Wait, did you just say that Maokai's ult leaves little room for error?

Fucking LOL.

it's actually pretty nice that they split up his ult into 5 pieces. the video even shows this, yasuo windwall only blocks one piece of it. whereas a nami ult just disappears if it even grazes a windwall or braum shield. a sej ult bola would just disappear at a windwall too
